title: Hope Church
problem: HopeIsReal needed a modern website that conveyed their mission, encouraged donations, and was easy to update internally.
solution: Designed and developed a full WordPress site with ACF blocks, custom buttons in React, and performance/accessibility optimizations.
summary: Modern WordPress rebuild with ACF blocks and React-driven CTAs so HopeIsReal can inspire donors and keep content fresh.

title: Perc
subtitle: Policy research institute
problem: Perc.org required a large-scale redesign and migration, including thousands of research pages, improved information architecture, and a robust search and filtering experience to support active researchers.
solution: Partnered with Kestrel and Atomic Dust on a full site redesign and migration. Built custom Gutenberg and Kadence blocks from Figma designs, migrated thousands of pages, and developed Alpine-powered filtering using the WordPress REST API to support fast, flexible research discovery.
summary: Large-scale, agency-led WordPress redesign and migration with a custom block system and Alpine-powered search that makes deep policy research easy to explore.

title: Buffalo Store
subtitle: Industrial tools ecommerce
problem: BuffaloCorp needed a better e-commerce experience, particularly around navigation and product search.
solution: Redesigned the storefront with a jQuery-powered mega menu and custom Gutenberg blocks for a better product discovery flow.
summary: Commerce-focused redesign with jQuery mega navigation and custom Gutenberg blocks so shoppers can find the right tools faster.

title: New2SATX
subtitle: Local moving & relocation guide
problem: A new business needed guidance and execution on building their first digital presence.
solution: Guided them through site structure and layout, implemented SEO and analytics setup using Google tools.
summary: Launched the brand’s first site with guided IA, SEO, and analytics so the new business starts strong online.

title: Ascent
subtitle: B2B security & compliance
problem: Ascent partnered with Kestrel and Dovetail for a full marketing site redesign and needed a build team to translate their Figma system into a flexible WordPress experience.
solution: Worked alongside the partner agencies to rebuild the site from the approved Figma files, wiring ACF-driven custom post types, bespoke blocks, and Kadence sections so every page can mix custom layouts with reusable components.
summary: Agency partnership with Kestrel and Dovetail delivering a Figma-to-WordPress rebuild powered by ACF CPTs, custom blocks, and Kadence layouts.

title: BC Web Studio
subtitle: Web Engineer
problem: BC Web Studio needed a home for its own services that separated agency partnerships from business consulting while showcasing vetted case studies, service frameworks, and operating principles in one place.
solution: Designed and developed an Eleventy marketing site with JSON-driven case studies, Alpine.js filtering, and dedicated "For Agencies" and "For Businesses" landing pages. Built a Tailwind/PostCSS component system, reusable info cards, and media carousels powered by structured project data so updates stay fast and consistent.
summary: Created BC Web Studio’s Eleventy marketing hub with Alpine filtering and data-driven case studies tailored to agencies and businesses.

title: St. Louis Lambert
subtitle: International Airport
problem: Lambert Airport’s public site hadn’t kept pace with traveler expectations: flight status, TSA, parking, and concessions data lived in disconnected systems, navigation was confusing, and the previous theme couldn’t meet the stricter accessibility and multilingual requirements.
solution: Partnered with Kestrel and Dovetail to rebuild FlySTL with a WordPress theme. Wired Kadence + ACF blocks for every layout and layered Alpine.js components that talk to flight, TSA, and parking APIs. Built flight-status and search modules that hydrate from the airport feed and parking cards that query SuperParkingLot in real time. Hardened navigation with accessible mega menus, header tab panels, ReciteMe + Google Translate helpers, and skip-link/keyboard patterns. Implemented custom post types so the airport team can manage updates without engineers.
summary: Led FlySTL’s API-connected, accessible WordPress rebuild in collaboration with internal and agency stakeholders, delivering live travel data widgets and Kadence/ACF layouts that keep passengers informed.

title: Holland
subtitle: Commercial construction
problem: Holland’s legacy marketing site looked outdated, scattered work by sector, and lacked the filtering and CMS flexibility needed for the Kestrel + Dovetail team to tell the whole story without developer help.
solution: Partnered with Kestrel and Dovetail to translate their Figma redesign into a Kadence-powered WordPress build. Delivered bespoke Gutenberg blocks, CPTs, and a filter/tab system that lets sales and marketing surface projects, services, and regions with just a few clicks.
summary: Joint agency rebuild with Kestrel and Dovetail that turned the Holland site into a Kadence + custom-block experience with CPT-driven filters and tabbed storytelling.

title: Dan St. Romain
subtitle: Educational Consulting
problem: Dan Stro Main needed help improving site performance and maintainability while transitioning away from Elementor on a live WooCommerce site, and wanted to introduce gated digital content for members.
solution: Provided ongoing technical support to migrate layouts from Elementor to Kadence, resolve WooCommerce layout and speed issues, and implement a WooCommerce-based digital content membership system without disrupting existing sales.
summary: Long-term WooCommerce support engagement focused on performance, Kadence migration, and a digital content membership system for a growing individual business.

title: Dan St. Romain
subtitle: LearnDash Courses
problem: Dan St. Romain needed a scalable course platform to deliver digital education, migrate existing content into a modern layout, and enforce structured learning progress with assessments and gated content.
solution: Built and migrated courses using LearnDash, transitioned layouts into a Kadence-based design system, automated user registrations with a custom plugin workflow, and implemented BuddyPress for student communication. Added custom PHP and JavaScript logic for learner note-taking, quiz enforcement, and conditional access rules that lock or hide topics until required quizzes are passed.
summary: Custom LearnDash course platform with Kadence layouts, automated enrollment, gated learning progression, learner note-taking, and BuddyPress-powered community features.

title: Tri-Star Systems
subtitle: Enrollment & Benefits Workflow
problem: Tri-Star Systems needed to modernize their participant-facing application while preserving existing backend APIs and guiding users through a complex enrollment and benefits review process.
solution: Rebuilt the participant application using Eleventy templates and Tailwind CSS, integrating existing API endpoints and implementing advanced, state-driven workflows with Alpine.js to guide participants through sign-up, health information review, and insurance election confirmation.
summary: Modernized participant application with Eleventy, Tailwind, and Alpine.js that integrates existing APIs and guides users through a complex, multi-step enrollment and benefits workflow.

title: Worship Planning
subtitle: AI-Assisted Worship & Team Coordination
problem: A growing church needed a better way to plan worship services by connecting scripture, themes, song selection, and volunteer scheduling—while coordinating communication across a rotating team.
solution: Designed and built a nonprofit-focused web application that integrates Google Spreadsheets and Google Documents with AI-powered logic. The app analyzes scripture text to determine service themes, selects appropriate worship songs from an existing Google Docs song database, manages team scheduling with exclusion dates, and provides built-in email communication for upcoming services.
summary: Built an AI-assisted worship planning app that connects scripture-based theme analysis, intelligent song selection, team scheduling, and email communication using Google Workspace tools.

title: Lindesca
subtitle: Custom Kadence Block Design & Styling
problem: Lindesca needed a modern, visually distinctive website that balanced editorial-style layouts with performance, accessibility, and easy content management in WordPress.
solution: Built a custom WordPress site using Kadence blocks with tailored styling and layout logic. Developed custom block configurations, advanced CSS styling, and a horizontally scrolling section to create a unique visual rhythm while maintaining editor-friendly content management.
summary: Designed and built a custom WordPress Kadence block site featuring bespoke block styling, editorial layouts, and a horizontally scrolling section for visual storytelling.
